intro: Psychotria piperi, commonly known as the Piper's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and produces small, clustered white flowers. It is also known for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure. Psychotria piperi is often cultivated in shaded gardens and greenhouses where it thrives in moist, well-drained soil.
